p: The data collected in the four study sites differed due to the distinctive features of each site. H5N1 data was collected in Thailand, H5 seroprevalence data at multiple time points in Vietnam, and cross-sectional low-pathogenic AIV seroprevalence data in Madagascar. Due to differences in the sampling protocols of the preliminary surveys used on the four sites, we had to re-arrange the data and redefine the epidemiological unit. We worked at the finest unit for which spatial coordinates were available. This unit was the village in Thailand and the two sites in Vietnam (Red River Delta and the highlands), and the farm in Madagascar. Outbreaks and prevalence data collected at various dates across study sites ( Figure S1) were aggregated over time with the aim to obtain an overall view of the AIV situation for each study site.
